columns.name: snapshot_identifier
columns.description: The unique identifier of the cluster.

columns.name: cluster_identifier
columns.description: The identifier of the cluster for which the snapshot was taken.

columns.name: snapshot_type
columns.description: The snapshot type.

columns.name: actual_incremental_backup_size_in_mega_bytes
columns.description: The size of the incremental backup.

columns.name: availability_zone
columns.description: The Availability Zone in which the cluster was created.

columns.name: backup_progress_in_mega-bytes
columns.description: The number of megabytes that have been transferred to the snapshot backup.

columns.name: cluster_create_time
columns.description: The time (UTC) when the cluster was originally created.

columns.name: cluster_version
columns.description: The version ID of the Amazon Redshift engine that is running on the cluster.

columns.name: current_backup_rate_in_mega_bytes_per_second
columns.description: The number of megabytes per second being transferred to the snapshot backup.

columns.name: db_name
columns.description: The name of the database that was created when the cluster was created.

columns.name: elapsed_time_in_seconds
columns.description: The amount of time an in-progress snapshot backup has been running, or the amount of time it took a completed backup to finish.

columns.name: encrypted
columns.description: If true, the data in the snapshot is encrypted at rest.

columns.name: encrypted_with_hsm
columns.description: A boolean that indicates whether the snapshot data is encrypted using the HSM keys of the source cluster.

columns.name: engine_full_version
columns.description: The cluster version of the cluster used to create the snapshot.

columns.name: enhanced_vpc_routing
columns.description: An option that specifies whether to create the cluster with enhanced VPC routing enabled.

columns.name: estimated_seconds_to_completion
columns.description: The estimate of the time remaining before the snapshot backup will complete.

columns.name: kms_key_id
columns.description: The AWS KMS key ID of the encryption key that was used to encrypt data in the cluster from which the snapshot was taken.

columns.name: maintenance_track_name
columns.description: The name of the maintenance track for the snapshot.

columns.name: manual_snapshot_remaining_days
columns.description: The number of days until a manual snapshot will pass its retention period.

columns.name: manual_snapshot_retention_period
columns.description: The number of days that a manual snapshot is retained.

columns.name: master_username
columns.description: The master user name for the cluster.

columns.name: node_type
columns.description: The node type of the nodes in the cluster.

columns.name: number_of_nodes
columns.description: The number of nodes in the cluster.

columns.name: owner_account
columns.description: The AWS customer account used to create or copy the snapshot.

columns.name: port
columns.description: The port that the cluster is listening on.

columns.name: snapshot_create_time
columns.description: The time (in UTC format) when Amazon Redshift began the snapshot.

columns.name: snapshot_retention_start_time
columns.description: A timestamp representing the start of the retention period for the snapshot.

columns.name: source_region
columns.description: The source region from which the snapshot was copied.

columns.name: status
columns.description: The snapshot status.

columns.name: total_backup_size_in_mega_bytes
columns.description: The size of the complete set of backup data that would be used to restore the cluster.

columns.name: vpc_id
columns.description: The VPC identifier of the cluster if the snapshot is from a cluster in a VPC.

columns.name: accounts_with_restore_access
columns.description: A list of the AWS customer accounts authorized to restore the snapshot.

columns.name: restorable_node_types
columns.description: The list of node types that this cluster snapshot is able to restore into.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: The list of tags for the cluster.
